contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2012}} {{otherships|USS Gridley}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[Image:USS Gridley DDG-101.jpg|300px|USS Gridley DDG-101]] |Ship caption= USS ''Gridley'' (DDG-101) }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=United States |Ship flag={{USN flag}} |Ship name= |Ship namesake=Captain [[Charles Gridley]] |Ship ordered=6 March 1998 |Ship builder=[[Bath Iron Works]] |Ship laid down=30 July 2004 |Ship launched=28 December 2005 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=10 February 2007 |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= |Ship status={{Ship in active service}} |Ship notes= |Ship motto=''IGNIS UBI PARATUS'' (“Fire when ready”) |Ship badge=[[File:USS Gridley DDG-101 Crest.png|150px]] }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class={{sclass|Arleigh Burke|destroyer}} |Ship displacement={{convert|9200|LT|abbr=on}} |Ship length={{convert|509|ft|6|in|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|66|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship draught={{convert|31|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= |Ship propulsion=4 × [[General Electric LM2500|General Electric LM2500-30]] [[gas turbine]]s, 2 shafts, {{convert|100000|shp|MW|abbr=on|lk=in}} |Ship speed=>{{convert|30|kn|abbr=on|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship complement=380 officers and enlisted |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=1 × 32 cell, 1 × 64 cell Mk 41 [[vertical launch system]]s, 96 × [[RIM-66 Standard|RIM-66 SM-2]], [[BGM-109 Tomahawk]] or [[RUM-139 VL-Asroc]], missiles<br>1 × 5/62 in (127/62 mm), 2 × 25 mm, 4 × 12.7 mm guns<br>2 × Mk 46 triple torpedo tubes<br>1 x 20mm [[Phalanx CIWS]] |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft=2 x [[SH-60 Sea Hawk]] helicopters |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} The fourth '''USS ''Gridley'' (DDG-101)''' is the fifty-first [[Arleigh Burke class destroyer|''Arleigh Burke''-class destroyer]] in the [[United States Navy]]. ''Gridley'' is named after [[Captain (U.S. Navy)|Captain]] [[Charles Vernon Gridley|Charles Gridley]], Commander of Admiral [[George Dewey]]'s flagship [[USS Olympia (C-6)|''Olympia'']], (Flag Captain) and recipient of [[Admiral]] Dewey's famous command, "You may fire when you are ready, Gridley" in the [[Battle of Manila Bay]] during the [[Spanish-American War]]. In May 2004, the [[United States Secretary of the Navy|Secretary of the Navy]] announced the names of five new ''Arleigh Burke'' class destroyers, including ''Gridley''. Her keel was laid on 30 July 2004 at the [[Bath Iron Works]] in [[Bath, Maine|Bath]], Maine. She was christened on 11 February 2006. The ''Gridley'' was commissioned at the Port of Miami on Saturday, 10 February 2007. She has joined the [[U.S. Pacific Fleet|Pacific Fleet]] and is homeported at [[Naval Base San Diego]]. ''Gridley'' departed [[Naval Base San Diego]] on 19 May 2008 for her maiden deployment and returned on 25 November 2008.<ref>[http://www.military.com/news/article/navy-news/uss-ronald-reagans-third-deployment.html USS Ronald Reagan's Third Deployment] ''Military.com''</ref> ==Commanding Officers== The commanding officer (CO) of the of the USS Gridley (DDG-101), is the United States Navy officer who is the most senior officer on ship.
